p: The biologically active monoterpenes α-pinene and limonene were found in the main compounds of the RM variety. α-pinene was described as the main component of most EOs derived from the plant kingdom [ 45, 46]. This compound is integrated as a basic intermediate in bakery and chilled dairy products [ 47]. Several studies report that the isomers of pinenes, especially α-pinene, have various biological potentialities such as anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, anticancer, antiviral, flavor, fragrance, antiallergy, and fungicidal activities [ 45]. On the other hand, D-limonene was reported as a safe anticancer agent, particularly for breast cancer [ 48]. As a result, the guava leaves’ high biomass yield could be considered a rich resource for these effective and sustainable bioactive compounds.
